title: The Extremes Explorer
story: Finding the largest and smallest values is a common task! Python's max() and min() functions make it easy. You can find extremes in lists, compare multiple values, or even use custom comparison logic.
instructions: Create a list `temperatures` with [72, 68, 75, 70, 78, 65, 73]. Find `highest` using max(), `lowest` using min(), and calculate `temp_range` (difference between highest and lowest). Print all three values.
solutionHidden:
temperatures = [72, 68, 75, 70, 78, 65, 73]
highest = max(temperatures)
lowest = min(temperatures)
temp_range = highest - lowest
print(highest)
print(lowest)
print(temp_range)

tests.description: Should print highest, lowest, and range
tests.expectedBehavior: Output should show all three values

hints.text: Use max(list) to find largest value, min(list) for smallest
Calculate range by subtracting lowest from highest
highest = max(temperatures), lowest = min(temperatures), temp_range = highest - lowest
